<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/01/tesla-passes-toyotato-become-valuable-automaker-world?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Toyota Is Number One No Elonger
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Tesla is first" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTc5L3Rlc2xhX2lzX2ZpcnN0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Stop cringing, you know you cracked a smile. Yesterday, electric automaker Tesla officially became the most valuable car manufacturer in the world after blowing by Toyota. Its stock, which has more than doubled since the start of the year, hit an all-time high to push Tesla’s market cap past $207 billion. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To put that in perspective, Tesla is now more valuable than Honda, Ferrari, BMW, GM, Nikola, and Nissan...combined. Some more perspective: Tesla produced about 103,000 vehicles in Q1—Toyota made <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/01/tesla-tops-toyota-to-become-largest-automaker-by-market-value.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2.4 million</a> over the same three months.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But to investors, growth potential > current production and Tesla is certainly growing. It delivered 367,500 vehicles in 2019, 50% more than in 2018. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Which is good because...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Electric vehicles are expected to dominate the auto market in coming years—BloombergNEF predicts 58% of passenger vehicle sales worldwide will be electric in 2040. And Tesla, with its estimated <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-06-25/tesla-overtaking-toyota-reflects-market-shift-to-tech?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">60% share of the U.S. EV market</a>, is well-positioned to capitalize, having built a significant advantage in areas where traditional automakers struggle.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Tech: </strong></span><span>“They have an amazing software advantage over everyone else,” Ark Invest analyst Tasha Keeney told CNBC (Ark Invest is a Tesla investor). The automaker has released over 300 software updates since 2011. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Battery:</strong></span><span> Tesla batteries recently broke the 400-mile per charge threshold, 100 miles better than its closest competitor. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The wider U.S. auto market is struggling just as Tesla engages Ludicrous mode. U.S. vehicle sales for GM, Toyota, and Fiat Chrysler dropped by <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/01/coronavirus-is-expected-to-tank-us-auto-sales-in-the-second-quarter.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over 30%</a> each in Q2 as fleet sales to governments and businesses froze. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> It’s hard to believe but Tesla still isn’t listed on the S&P 500. The major index requires a company to post four consecutive quarters of accumulated profit, which Tesla has yet to achieve. But it’s right on the verge of inclusion after three straight profitable quarters. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/01/chinese-national-security-law-goes-effect-threatens-economic-order?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China’s New Security Law: What You Need to Know
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, a Chinese national security law targeting subversive activity in Hong Kong went into effect. It is...very unpopular among governments not named China, who say it violates the autonomy Hong Kong was granted when the territory was transferred from British rule to Chinese rule in 1997. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Police </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-police-make-first-security-law-arrest-as-thousands-protest-11593591072?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrested</a></span><span> hundreds of protesters on Wednesday, the first day the law became active.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The biz fallout: </strong>is significant. You’ve seen its skyline—Hong Kong is an international hub for trade, finance, and multinational HQs. But the new Chinese law could spook those companies and threaten HK’s economic relationship with the rest of the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Actually, it already has. The U.S. has begun to <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/01/world/asia/hong-kong-security-law-china.html?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">roll back</a> its special trade status with Hong Kong and is stopping defense exports. And lawmakers are preparing to introduce legislation that bans certain Chinese companies from accessing U.S. capital markets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>From the coronavirus to allegations of Chinese human rights abuses against Uighur Muslims, the U.S. has taken a harder tack against China. This new HK law drives a further wedge between the two economic powers.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/01/san-francisco-apartment-prices-plunge-june?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When @Jack Says You Can Work From Anywhere
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Sponge Bob walking backwards out of door" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=433 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/48FhEMYGWji8/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Sponge Bob walking backwards out of door" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/48FhEMYGWji8/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Rent for a one bedroom apartment in San Francisco <a href="https://www.zumper.com/blog/rental-price-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plunged nearly 12%</a> year-over-year in June, according to apartment rental platform Zumper. That’s a record decline for the city and the largest drop of any market in the country. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>What’s happening in SF is happening in large cities across the U.S. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Zumper’s calling it the “Brooklyn Effect”—when people move from expensive cities to less expensive cities close by (could probably use a name change at this point). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Prices in two of those cheaper cities, Sacramento, CA, and Providence, RI, rose around 5% last month while the majority of the most expensive markets trended down. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why is this happening? </strong>Cities are for work and play. As more employers embrace remote work and bars prove to be a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/texas-florida-put-curbs-bars-stem-outbreaks-among-young-people?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">popular coronavirus hangout</a>, overpriced apartments lose their appeal—even if they were once great pregame spots.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the effect is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-tech-firms-rethink-san-francisco-silicon-valley-stands-to-gain-11592308801?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most pronounced</a> in the tech hub of San Francisco, where companies are 1) more likely to implement “work from anywhere” policies or 2) have shed jobs as the pandemic crushed their business.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Award-winning journalist Soledad O’Brien hosts <a href="https://www.hpe.com/us/en/discover-more-network/discover-virtual-experience-2020.brightcove.767c21bd-3f16-4a24-8d22-2e32b622d4e7.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three insightful panel sessions</a> featuring some of the tech and business world’s most influential female voices to discuss leadership, building resilience, and facilitating opportunities for greater diversity. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Topics covered will include:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Covid-19’s effect on the global economy</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Adapting to a changing workplace</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Leading through recovery during complex times</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">And, we’re not being hyperbolic when we say this: Way, way, way more</strong></span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first two sessions are <a href="https://www.hpe.com/us/en/discover-more-network/discover-virtual-experience-2020.brightcove.767c21bd-3f16-4a24-8d22-2e32b622d4e7.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">available to watch now</a>. The final panel will air next Wednesday, July 8, where O’Brien and four female execs from HPE will discuss the greatest changes taking place today, and what qualities are most essential to grow and thrive in the near and long-term.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After you <a href="https://www.hpe.com/us/en/discover-more-network/discover-virtual-experience-2020.brightcove.767c21bd-3f16-4a24-8d22-2e32b622d4e7.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">watch the first two sessions on demand</a>, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/470904703;276401576;h" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">register (for free) </a>to check out the additional panels, trainings, sessions, and talks that HPE’s virtual conference has to offer.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/01/npc-hoping-bankrupt-pizza-still-hits?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NPC Hoping Bankrupt Pizza Still Hits the Same
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NPC International, the largest Pizza Hut franchisee in the U.S. and an operator of almost 400 Wendy's locations, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/01/pizza-huts-largest-us-franchisee-files-for-chapter-11-bankruptcy.html#:~:text=Bloomberg%20%7C%20Getty%20Images-,NPC%20International%2C%20the%20largest%20U.S.%20franchisee%20of%20Yum%20Brands'%20Pizza,and%20nearly%20400%20Wendy's%20restaurants.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for bankruptcy</a> yesterday. Pizza Hut has 7,100 restaurants in the U.S. ,1,200 of which are operated by NPC, most of which are struggling. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">A combo we’ve seen before </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/01/business/npc-international-pizza-hut-bankruptcy/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPC blamed</a> coronavirus-related store closures, nearly $1 billion in debt, and everything from food to labor getting more expensive for its bankruptcy filing. But, despite the challenges of its franchisee, Pizza Hut is actually doing okay during the pandemic.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In early May, average U.S. sales in delivery and takeout reached an eight-year high. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Our two cents: </strong></span><span>Announce you are banning pineapple on pizza. Sales would go through the roof.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Franchised restaurant companies are suffering from a massive drop off in customers—Chuck E. Cheese's parent company filed for bankruptcy after transactions at U.S. family dining restaurants fell more than 80% in mid-April. Emerging Tech Brew writer Ryan Duffy <a href="https://twitter.com/RyanfDuffy/status/1276167801179451395?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">thinks he knows why</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/01/prominent-americans-say-take-ufos-seriously?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Should We Be Taking UFO Sightings More Seriously?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="UFO invasion" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/TEdQEWK7738MhGayO7/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="UFO invasion" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/TEdQEWK7738MhGayO7/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In April, the Pentagon reignited the fire under Naruto-runners’ feet when <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/28/us/pentagon-ufo-videos.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">it released</a> three Navy videos of unidentified flying objects (UFOs). These physics-defying aerial phenomena elevated the UFO conversation from Bigfoot Reddit forums to Bloomberg opinion columns.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To celebrate World UFO Day today, here are a few prominent thinkers saying we should take UFO sightings <em>more </em>seriously: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. Former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid <a href="https://twitter.com/SenatorReid/status/1254836730546384897?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">on Twitter</a>: “The U.S. needs to take a serious, scientific look at this and any potential national security implications. The American people deserve to be informed.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. Economist Tyler Cowen <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-05-01/ufo-sightings-they-deserve-to-be-taken-more-seriously?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">for Bloomberg</a>: “Humanity has a long history of being caught unawares by outside arrivals, and so we should pay more attention to that bias in ourselves.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He cited the “technologically superior” Spanish invasion of the Aztec empire as an example. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Famous political scientist Alexander Wendt <a href="https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2020/5/8/21244090/pentagon-ufo-videos-navy-alexander-wendt?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to Vox</a>: “Whether it’s alien life, who knows? It’s a plausible explanation. My point is that we should be agnostic about this and simply study it scientifically. Let’s do the science and then we can talk about what we found.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The overarching argument: </strong>Strange phenomena should be investigated, whether the end goal is to protect ourselves from cone-headed extraterrestrials, or just to learn something new.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ If you want to learn something new...</strong>here are all the <a href="https://www.history.com/ufo-sightings-location-map?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UFO sightings</a> taken seriously by the U.S. government.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Level up your productivity: </strong>Join entrepreneur, author, and productivity guru Nir Eyal for a 2-week workshop that will let you take back control of your work life. You’ll learn an actionable framework for planning ahead, controlling your attention, and generally becoming a less distracted, more focused person. <a href="https://www.nirandfar.com/becoming-indistractable/?partner=morningbrew&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=partner&utm_campaign=mb_course_0701&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Enable cookies:</strong> Here's a <a href="https://www.munchrecipes.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Chrome extension</a> (thanks, Brew reader Henry) that'll give you a new recipe recommendation each time you open up a browser tab. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hitting the road for the Fourth of July? </strong>Here’s our anti-boredom listening list.</p>

FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>

<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every other Thursday, we’re bringing you a few of our favorite business-related reads. This week, we’re talking careers, from acing the first impression to pulling a 180. </em></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/books/pivot-the-only-move-that-matters-is-your-next-one/9780143129035?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Pivot</em></a></span><span> by Jenny Blake is your map for navigating the quickly evolving jobs market. No matter where you're at in your career, it offers useful frameworks for thinking about next steps and strategies to get there. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/books/brave-not-perfect-fear-less-fail-more-and-live-bolder/9781524762339?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Brave, Not Perfect</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>tackles the hard-to-see but very real structural challenges facing women in the workplace. Author Reshma Saujani, founder of Girls Who Code, encourages women to build resilience, normalize failure, and let go of the fear holding them back. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We couldn’t stop at just two. We’ve got four additional books with career advice and inspiration on Brew’s Bookshelf’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fancy new homepage</a>, where you can also scroll through all our previous recommendations.</p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nToyota Is Number One No Elonger\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Tesla is first\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStop cringing, you know you cracked a smile. Yesterday, electric automaker Tesla officially became the most valuable car manufacturer in the world after blowing by Toyota. Its stock, which has more than doubled since the start of the year, hit an all-time high to push Tesla’s market cap past $207 billion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo put that in perspective, Tesla is now more valuable than Honda, Ferrari, BMW, GM, Nikola, and Nissan...combined. Some more perspective: Tesla produced about 103,000 vehicles in Q1—Toyota made \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/01/tesla-tops-toyota-to-become-largest-automaker-by-market-value.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2.4 million\u003c/a\u003e over the same three months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut to investors, growth potential \u003e current production and Tesla is certainly growing. It delivered 367,500 vehicles in 2019, 50% more than in 2018. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhich is good because...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eElectric vehicles are expected to dominate the auto market in coming years—BloombergNEF predicts 58% of passenger vehicle sales worldwide will be electric in 2040. And Tesla, with its estimated \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-06-25/tesla-overtaking-toyota-reflects-market-shift-to-tech?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e60% share of the U.S. EV market\u003c/a\u003e, is well-positioned to capitalize, having built a significant advantage in areas where traditional automakers struggle.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTech: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“They have an amazing software advantage over everyone else,” Ark Invest analyst Tasha Keeney told CNBC (Ark Invest is a Tesla investor). The automaker has released over 300 software updates since 2011. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBattery:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Tesla batteries recently broke the 400-mile per charge threshold, 100 miles better than its closest competitor. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe wider U.S. auto market is struggling just as Tesla engages Ludicrous mode. U.S. vehicle sales for GM, Toyota, and Fiat Chrysler dropped by \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/01/coronavirus-is-expected-to-tank-us-auto-sales-in-the-second-quarter.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover 30%\u003c/a\u003e each in Q2 as fleet sales to governments and businesses froze. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s hard to believe but Tesla still isn’t listed on the S\u0026P 500. The major index requires a company to post four consecutive quarters of accumulated profit, which Tesla has yet to achieve. But it’s right on the verge of inclusion after three straight profitable quarters. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nChina’s New Security Law: What You Need to Know\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, a Chinese national security law targeting subversive activity in Hong Kong went into effect. It is...very unpopular among governments not named China, who say it violates the autonomy Hong Kong was granted when the territory was transferred from British rule to Chinese rule in 1997. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePolice \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hong-kong-police-make-first-security-law-arrest-as-thousands-protest-11593591072?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earrested\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e hundreds of protesters on Wednesday, the first day the law became active.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe biz fallout: \u003c/strong\u003eis significant. You’ve seen its skyline—Hong Kong is an international hub for trade, finance, and multinational HQs. But the new Chinese law could spook those companies and threaten HK’s economic relationship with the rest of the world.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eActually, it already has. The U.S. has begun to \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/01/world/asia/hong-kong-security-law-china.html?utm_source=nextdraft\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eroll back\u003c/a\u003e its special trade status with Hong Kong and is stopping defense exports. And lawmakers are preparing to introduce legislation that bans certain Chinese companies from accessing U.S. capital markets.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFrom the coronavirus to allegations of Chinese human rights abuses against Uighur Muslims, the U.S. has taken a harder tack against China. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRent for a one bedroom apartment in San Francisco \u003ca href=\"https://www.zumper.com/blog/rental-price-data/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplunged nearly 12%\u003c/a\u003e year-over-year in June, according to apartment rental platform Zumper. That’s a record decline for the city and the largest drop of any market in the country. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWhat’s happening in SF is happening in large cities across the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eZumper’s calling it the “Brooklyn Effect”—when people move from expensive cities to less expensive cities close by (could probably use a name change at this point). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrices in two of those cheaper cities, Sacramento, CA, and Providence, RI, rose around 5% last month while the majority of the most expensive markets trended down. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy is this happening? \u003c/strong\u003eCities are for work and play. As more employers embrace remote work and bars prove to be a \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/26/texas-florida-put-curbs-bars-stem-outbreaks-among-young-people?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epopular coronavirus hangout\u003c/a\u003e, overpriced apartments lose their appeal—even if they were once great pregame spots.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut the effect is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-tech-firms-rethink-san-francisco-silicon-valley-stands-to-gain-11592308801?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost pronounced\u003c/a\u003e in the tech hub of San Francisco, where companies are 1) more likely to implement “work from anywhere” policies or 2) have shed jobs as the pandemic crushed their business.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Pizza Hut has 7,100 restaurants in the U.S. ,1,200 of which are operated by NPC, most of which are struggling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eA combo we’ve seen before \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/01/business/npc-international-pizza-hut-bankruptcy/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNPC blamed\u003c/a\u003e coronavirus-related store closures, nearly $1 billion in debt, and everything from food to labor getting more expensive for its bankruptcy filing. But, despite the challenges of its franchisee, Pizza Hut is actually doing okay during the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn early May, average U.S. sales in delivery and takeout reached an eight-year high. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOur two cents: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnnounce you are banning pineapple on pizza. width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn April, the Pentagon reignited the fire under Naruto-runners’ feet when \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/28/us/pentagon-ufo-videos.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eit released\u003c/a\u003e three Navy videos of unidentified flying objects (UFOs). These physics-defying aerial phenomena elevated the UFO conversation from Bigfoot Reddit forums to Bloomberg opinion columns.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo celebrate World UFO Day today, here are a few prominent thinkers saying we should take UFO sightings \u003cem\u003emore \u003c/em\u003eseriously: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e1. Former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/SenatorReid/status/1254836730546384897?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eon Twitter\u003c/a\u003e: “The U.S. needs to take a serious, scientific look at this and any potential national security implications. The American people deserve to be informed.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e2. Economist Tyler Cowen \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-05-01/ufo-sightings-they-deserve-to-be-taken-more-seriously?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efor Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e: “Humanity has a long history of being caught unawares by outside arrivals, and so we should pay more attention to that bias in ourselves.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHe cited the “technologically superior” Spanish invasion of the Aztec empire as an example. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e3. Famous political scientist Alexander Wendt \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2020/5/8/21244090/pentagon-ufo-videos-navy-alexander-wendt?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto Vox\u003c/a\u003e: “Whether it’s alien life, who knows? It’s a plausible explanation. My point is that we should be agnostic about this and simply study it scientifically. Let’s do the science and then we can talk about what we found.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe overarching argument: \u003c/strong\u003eStrange phenomena should be investigated, whether the end goal is to protect ourselves from cone-headed extraterrestrials, or just to learn something new.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ If you want to learn something new...\u003c/strong\u003ehere are all the \u003ca href=\"https://www.history.com/ufo-sightings-location-map?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eUFO sightings\u003c/a\u003e taken seriously by the U.S. government.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
